text:
Customers want an easy way to store, replicate, and
access copies of Amazon S3 data in multiple AWS Regions.
Achieving this used to be challenging.

You used to have to create regionally isolated copies of your data
wherever in the world you needed them using S3 Replication.

Then, to access these multi-region datasets, you used to
need to build logic into your multi-region applications
to route requests to the correct regional copy of your data.

As a result, your applications used to need to keep
track of which clients route to which AWS Region.
This complexity used to be difficult to manage.
Used to.

Now, with Amazon S3 Multi-Region Access Points, you can
accelerate and simplify storage for multi-region applications!

S3 Multi-region Access Points provide a single global endpoint to
access a replicated data set spanning multiple buckets in S3.

Application requests made to a Multi-region Access Pointâ€™s
global endpoint automatically route over the AWS network

to the S3 bucket with the lowest network latency,
which can help applications run up to 60% faster.

This lets your multi-region applications take
advantage of the global infrastructure of AWS,
avoiding congested network segments on the public internet

and improving application performance,
to run anywhere in the world
all while maintaining a simple region-agnostic architecture.
Whether your application is running on-premises or within AWS,

they can also connect to a Multi-region Access Point
via AWS PrivateLink.

Establishing a PrivateLink connection to a
Multi-region Access point allows you to route

S3 requests into AWS, or across multiple
AWS Regions, over a private connection,
using a very simple network architecture and configuration.

In addition to providing new ways to
route application requests to Amazon S3,

Multi-region Access Points also delivers a new user experience
for managing all aspects of a multi-region S3 setup.

In the S3 Management Console, Multi-Region Access Points show a
centralized view of the underlying replication topology,

replication metrics, and request routing configuration
for your multi-region S3 deployment.

This gives you an even easier way to build, manage,
and monitor storage for multi-region applications.

To learn more about S3 Multi-Region Access Points,
please visit the feature page linked below:
